intro: Melampyrum arvense var. semleri, commonly known as yellow bartsia, is a flowering plant in the family Orobanchaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. Its roots are parasitic, drawing nutrients from the roots of nearby host plants. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions.
